PointerMoveEvent Class Reference

#include <PointerMoveEvent.h>

Inheritance diagram for PointerMoveEvent:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

The event that the position of the pointer (mouse, joystick etc.) is moved relative to its current position.

You do not need to ensure that the position stays within the screen, the event handler does that for you. The input handling of the adapter instantiates this class and adds them to the desktop's event queue by using its addEvent() method.

See also:
Desktop::addEvent()

Creates a new pointer move event.

Parameters:
option1 Whether the option button 1 is currently pressed, e.g. on Windows systems, this is the SHIFT key.
option2 Whether the option button 2 is currently pressed, e.g. on Windows systems, this is the CTRL key.
delta The relative movement for the pointer.
